body.name: The Night She Disappeared: A Novel
body.description: A 2022 Audie Award FinalistFrom the #1 New York Times bestselling author of Then She Was Gone comes “her best thriller yet” (Harlan Coben, New York Times bestselling author) about a young couple’s disappearance on a gorgeous summer night, and the mother who will never give up trying to find them.On a beautiful summer night in a charming English suburb, a young woman and her boyfriend disappear after partying at the massive country estate of a new college friend.One year later, a writer moves into a cottage on the edge of the woods that border the same estate. Known locally as the Dark Place, the dense forest is the writer’s favorite place for long walks and it’s on one such walk that she stumbles upon a mysterious note that simply reads, “DIG HERE.”Could this be a clue towards what has happened to the missing young couple? And what exactly is buried in this haunted ground?“Utterly gripping with richly drawn, hugely compelling characters, this is a first-class thriller with heart” (Lucy Foley, New York Times bestselling author) that will keep you on the edge of your seat. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars I was hooked from page 1!!
reviews.reviewText: this book is amazing just like every other Lisa Jewell novel. I literally couldn't put the book down. I also never write reviews so this means something!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Which is not a fave genre of mine. This was extremely well written. I appreciated the subject, timing and plot development. I wasn’t able to give it five stars, though, because it seems like a scramble to resolution towards the end of the book AND the title definitely gives away a very large clue, lol.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is my first Lisa Jewell book but it won’t be my last. I ordered many others. From page one I was pulled in and fortunately had a day off in which I could read for hours and so I read it in one sitting, could not put it down! What a fantastic writer Lisa is! All I can say is…WOW!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 15, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Came on time in and great condition, can wait to read it, love all her books!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Intense, somewhat dark, very suspenseful.
reviews.reviewText: There is a looming sense of fear and dread throughout the entire novel, definitely a could-not-put-it down listen. I loved the narration, perfect for this gripping novel.The plot is outstanding, typical of Lisa Jewell. Suspenseful and unique, not at all predictable.I’ve listened to over a hundred books since I retired 5 years ago and this is my 6th Lisa Jewell novel. Lisa Jewell is the only author I tolerate some profanity, as she uses it not for shock value, but for characterization. It is clearly used to make the reader dislike (even loath) some characters, to give particular characters’ uniqueness and personality. I also tolerate some of the sexual (not detailed) indiscretions in her books, and in this one a same sex relationship. All that said, there are some authors that can do all that without profanity or sex.The characters are so vivid and emotionally well-drawn. I cared what happened to them in spite of their flaws and poor life choices.I took off a star because there was just something “off” about the ending. Like it was so rushed that it needed to be explained in and epilogue? The Night She Disappeared has such a great storyline, such well-drawn layered characters, I’m not sure why the epilogue could not have been integrated into the character’s actions and events.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on June 29, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I expect A LOT for a book to be a good mystery, so three stars I feel is generous. The author weaves a decent story, but I'm really getting tired of every. single. book. doing the back and forth between times thing. And then the ending was a major let down, it could've been so much better! Page 247 actually made me mad, and I almost stopped reading because how stupid is this character to not realize this?! But I never don't finish a book, except for Infinite Jest 😂 so I kept going. If you're a fast reader and burn though a few books a week, sure, waste your time, but if you're looking for a really interesting mystery this is not it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is now one of my favorite thrillers. It is such a well fleshed out story. More people should pick it up.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Uninteresting content. Goes on and on to different scenarios.

reviews.reviewText: Despite figuring a few things out for myself as it went along, this book was still captivating. Great characters, well described with voices I can "hear" in my head. The whole story was entertaining and interesting, it kept up a great pace and was exactly what I was looking for.
From beginning to end, a great mystery that grabs you from page one. I've read many books of Jewell and loved them all, but this one leapt to number one favorite. Don't miss it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: Gets inside your head - loved it
reviews.reviewText: I adore Lisa Jewell's writing style - hugely atmospheric and visual but without being verbose - and I loved the plot of this twisty novel equally. The characters were spot on; flawed but sympathetic, particularly Kim and Tallulah - and there are other players that I loved to hate and found suspicious from the outset. Sophie is an enigma; a bored and lonely headmaster's partner, crime writer and amateur sleuth. I found her mildly irritating at times, but it soon became clear that she's vital to the plot. Oh, and the ending! It was everything I wanted. Thank you, LJ, for another riveting read.

reviews.reviewTitle: Lisa Jewel is an awesome author
reviews.reviewText: If you enjoy James Patterson's and Lee Child's novels, you'll like her.
